author: kevvles
content:
I'm largely a layman without tech or cryptographic background, so please excuse me if these are stupid questions:

In my mind, the Ethereum L2 (/L3/etc) ecosystem five years into the future will be a spectrum of both public and private networks that are laser-focused on their individual use-cases, but built on top of Ethereum so that there is underlying data composability. 

I only recently realized that I'm taking for granted that private networks can be built on top of Ethereum.

Can (ZK-EVM) L2 networks built on top of Ethereum be private?

As in, could a company build a private (ZK-EVM) L2 on the Ethereum mainnet that can only be accessed by those Ethereum accounts that they have given permission and allow to interact with the network?

Edit: Fixed terminology (I think)

author: potuz
content: Yes, that's a perfectly acceptable use case for a private network that wants to leverage Ethereum security
